title: Lunar lander company ispace sees opportunities in Japan-U.S. Artemis agreement
summary: An agreement between the United States and Japan on contributions for the Artemis lunar exploration campaign could create additional opportunities for a Japanese lunar lander developer.

title: NOAA says ‘extreme’ Solar storm will persist through the weekend
summary: So far disruptions from the geomagnetic storm appear to be manageable.

title: Serbia becomes latest country to join China’s ILRS moon base project
summary: Serbia has signed an agreement on participating in the China-led International Lunar Research Station.

title: Defense space policy chief calls Russia’s space nuke threat “a thing apart”
summary: John Plumb: Russia's potential development of a nuclear weapons for space is “egregious”

title: Pentagon space policy chief weighs in on disputes over battlefield intelligence

title: FAA to begin environmental review of Starship launches from Kennedy Space Center
summary: The Federal Aviation Administration is preparing to start an environmental review of SpaceX Starship launches from a pad at the Kennedy Space Center, reflecting changes in the vehicle since a 2019 assessment.
